page.title: 16THE NEW ESTATES.
page.content: Nicholson Park is an example of one of the estates built in the 1960's. It lies in Grands Vaux Valley below a large reservoir. With the big rise in the population (mainly due to immigration from the mainland) large waiting lists for properties grew. The States of Jersey decided to build a number of housing estates for both owner occupier and rental. From the mid sixties to early seventies areas of the least productive land were selected for these estates. A typical example of one of these is Maufant Village which lies near the northern border of the block. Housing on a small Island like Jersey will always be a problem as space is a very precious resource; these new estates have only gone part way to solving it.
